definition: to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: These satellites will go as piggyback on PSLV's (Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle), officials said.
sentences.chinese: 有官员称，这些卫星将搭乘印度的极轨卫星运载火箭。

sentences.english: For carrier rockets, however, the technique of lateral separation design is normally used.
sentences.chinese: 而运载火箭通常采用横向分离式设计技术。

sentences.english: Launch capability of liquid rocket engine can be improved by propellant utilization system.
sentences.chinese: 采用推进剂利用系统可以提高运载火箭的发射能力。

sentences.english: His intent was to somehow use the launcher he had.
sentences.chinese: 他的目的是设法使用他已有的运载火箭。

sentences.english: And a crewed vehicle could top $1 trillion.
sentences.chinese: 并且一枚载人运载火箭可能花费超过1万亿美元。

pinyin: zhou1 ji4 dan4 dao4 dao3 dan4

definition: Baikonur (Russian space launch site in Kazakhstan)
to shoot (a projectile)/to fire (a rocket)/to launch/to emit (a particle)/to discharge/emanation/emission
Cape Canaveral, Florida, home of Kennedy space center 肯尼迪航天中心[Ken3 ni2 di2 Hang2 tian1 Zhong1 xin1]
pinyin: Ka3 na4 wei2 la1 er3 jiao3
